channel.title: Newbie
channel.description: ok so im a bit of a newbie and after watching and reading many tutorials i still encounter problem after problem. all im wanting to do is have a server set up that me and a few friends can play on privately. No actual coding needs doing just literally getting the server online. i was hoping somebody could help over skype or teamviewer maybe? Sorry for the newbieness but this is a last resort Dx. Thanks in advance

item.title: Newbie
item.dc:creator: @raeman0012 raeman0012
item.description:
@raeman0012 wrote:

thanks ive sorted it now, did my inbound and outbound rules wrong

Read full topic

item.title: Newbie
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“raeman0012, post:3, topic:553979”]yeah sorry i’ve followed countless guides step by step yet port forwarding is just not working, keep getting the status connection rejected, i double and triple checked everything according to the guides and its still not happening.
also i have no clue on how to host my server on the google compute engine vps tried finding a tut but dont seem to be any specific ones for hosting rsps on their only minecraft ones[/quote]
Host a rsps would be similar to hosting a minecraft server. except you’re on port 43594, and using a different application.

As for port forwarding: Getting a rejection error usually means there’s a firewall… Have you tried disabling your firewall/antivirus, or your routers firewall?

Read full topic

item.title: Newbie
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You don’t tell us what you’re having a problem with.
Are you having a problem setting it up?
Turning it on?
Portforwarding?
Hosting?
Changing something (if so, what?)?

We need more information to help you.

Read full topic
